instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: i tried a revive it with the configurator and it gets stuck at step 4 of 4 installing system.  force quitting  the configurator is the only option. the board remains in dfu mode afterwards.

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message:
Any history available?
Try reflashing Soc ROM; don't forget to make backup first.

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: writing the Soc ROM didn't change anything.  I noticed that ppdcin is 19v only when a charged battery is attached to the board.  Otherwise the amp meter sits at 5v 0.000a and it is stuck in dfu

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message:
Still can't complete DFU, with both charger and battery connected?

Check UPC_I2C_INT_L level.

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: UPC_I2C_INT_L stays at 0v

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message:
That means you have a problem in USB-C area.
May have a bad CD3217, or associated component.

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: i see a lot of files for the u3060 being posted in forums.  I'm assuming that could be the problem

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: You can try; don't forget to make backup first.

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: replaced u3100 and u3200 today and it is still stuck in dfu mode and upc_i2c_int_l is 0v.  still waiting on the programmer for u3060

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: resistor r3441 isn't on the board and i'm not sure if it is supposed to be.  is it?

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message:
Some of the resistors from page 27 are not soldered.
They are marked on the BOM OPTION table.
Is better to compare with good board.

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: i'm getting 20v after programming u3060 with an original file.  the ppbus is still 12.3v and the device stays in dfu even after running the configurator.   upc_i2c_int_l is still 0v even though ppdcin is 20v.

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: Got 20V with just charger connected (no battery)?

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: yes. the 20v shows up on both ports with no battery attached

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: Can you complete DFU restore?

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: not without error  dfu to dfu. it basically stays in dfu mode. i never have to put it in dfu mode

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: i tried plugging in a charger in one port while doing a restore with the dfu port and apple came up on the display. apparently that 5 volts from the usb port of the other machine wasn't enough.  Now it's up and running again

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message: Possibly T2, or SSD problem...

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message:
Hopefully, not a massively unrelated question, didn't want to start a new thread just for this:

When doing a DFU revive/restore on a board that is drawing 5v 0.02a, as described in repair.wiki, is that power sufficient for the device to show up on configurator and complete the restore / revive ? I mean, during the revive, the screen comes up etc, would that all work ok with the power from the host Mac ? Or a separate charger / battery required ?

threads.title: 820-01958 stuck in dfu mode at 5v
threads.message:
Peoples reported on the Internet about some boards which didn't complete DFU without both charger and battery connected.
So be aware of that; some kind of trial and error applies.
We don't have confirmed list of models which pass DFU only with charger,
